sentence: Amdocs reported third-quarter 2014 results wherein the bottom line surpassed the Zacks Consensus Estimate while the top line was in line with the same.
Amdocs' opportunities in the U.S. are more visible after business stabilization with its major customer, AT&T, and renewal of long-term contracts with several leading telecom and cable TV operators.
The company has also won significant managed service contracts in the economically volatile Europe.
We believe that the long-term fundamentals of the company are intriguing owing to the gradual adoption of converged IP solutions by the telecom industry.
However, high customer concentration coupled with the continuous consolidation trend in the U.S. telecom industry may act as headwinds going forward.
Meanwhile, the stock is trading at a 52-week high price range.
We, thus, maintain our long-term Neutral recommendation on Amdocs.
Formed in 1982, Amdocs Limited (DOX) is a leading provider of customer relationship management (CRM) and billing software to communications service providers.
The company started as a manufacturer of telephone directory publishing technologies in Israel.
Since then it has completed several well-timed acquisitions including ITDS (in 1999), Solect (in 2000), Clarify (from Nortel in 2001) and Certen (from its partner, Bell Canada, in 2003).
All of these acquisitions complemented its original business.

Most importantly, Amdocs successfully combined its core billing and rating technology with Clarify's customer relationship management software to emerge as a leader in the market of business support systems.
Amdocs also acquired XACCT (in 2004), DST Innovis (in 2005) and Longshine Information Technology in Aug 2005.
In Apr 2006, the company purchased QPass, which established Amdocs as the market leader in the digital content segment.
Following this, Amdocs acquired Cramer Systems Group Ltd, a well known provider of Operating Support System solutions, with more than 80 large customers worldwide, in Aug 2006.
Amdocs' acquisitions of SigValue and Jacobs Rimmell Ltd. have significantly enhanced the company's presence in the emerging markets and new telecom segments.
Through these strategic acquisitions, Amdocs has become a unique vendor as it can now provide both end-to-end business support solutions and operating support solutions to the carrier marketplace.

Amdocs' business is organized into two reporting segments as follows:

Services: This segment provides a broad suite of comprehensive service offerings to the telecom service providers.
These include: Consulting & System Integration services, Managed services, Delivery services, and Product Support services.
The Services segment accounted for 97.6% of the total revenue in fiscal 2013.
License: This segment licenses Amdocs' proprietary software & software systems to other companies.
License revenues constituted the remaining 2.4% of the total revenue in fiscal 2013.
